properties.text: Buzz before the storm RT @VisitAvalonNJ: Cheers to Hurricane Sandy, swap tales with the locals tonight at Fred's Tavern http://t.co/ZgBIGTog
Today I'm reporting on what people in Cape May County are doing ahead of #Sandy, whether evacuating, waiting or throwing #hurricaneparty
First cloud cover from #Sandy is here in #Cape May http://t.co/8QnNoCCu
#CapeMay public works moving benches to higher ground. #Sandy #Frankenstormprep http://t.co/Mvth2GMa
People in #CapeMay not buying the #Sandy #hype. Talked to one carpenter boarding up a building who said he's staying #whatevacuation?
@GovChristie will be in North Wildwood this afternoon. #ACPress will be there. #Getthehelloffthebeach
@GovChristie declares state of emergency, yet most locals in #CapeMay say they aren't planning on leaving yet. They're jaded after #Irene.
#Wildwood Buggy Bash, traction kiting convention, going just fine ahead of #Sandy. Ending a day early, though. #Windy http://t.co/zX4hPIJr
Waiting for @GovChristie to speak in #NorthWildwood http://t.co/1EodY5u5
#Avalon sending pet shelter trailer to Cumberland Co. Tech Center in Bridgeton. Ppl should drive there w/ pets, then put in shelter. #Sandy
#Christie in Wildwood on #Sandy: AC casinos evacuate by 4 pm Sunday #acpress http://t.co/KMJ5e4rD
Bridges onto barrier islands will be closed at 4 pm on Sunday due to #sandy, OEM wants SUVs off roads before worst winds hit #acpress
Really hope #AC casinos move #Halloween parties to next weekend and not just cancel. @RevelNightlife @BorgataEvents @TropicanaAC @CaesarsAC
#Sandy shelter in Upper Twp Middle School. 80+ ppl and pets here, more on way after rescues on islands. #pressofac http://t.co/zDvdByyn
#capemay shelters: Upper Twp middle and elementary schools, Middle Twp elementary, Villas firehouse, Woodbine Developmental Center #sandy
Ppl at Cape May Co. shelters upbeat despite likely extensive damage to island homes, playing Scrabble, watching Spider-Man. #Sandy #acpress
600+ people at Cape May County's five shelters, more on the way. Nearly 9,000 homes without power in county now. #sandy #acpress
Don't know what I'd do if that sign blew down. “@theoceandrive: The OD is hanging in there! Please be safe everyone. http://t.co/1TUMg63N”
Insane: MT @HCPolice: No return to #LBI at least 10 days. Severe danger and damage to roads. Will take time to make things safe for everyone
At press conference in #oceancity #nj. City is covered in debris, muck and standing water. #sandy #acpress http://t.co/diQhrQhy
#OceanCity filled w/ sounds of front-end loaders moving debris, helicopter surveying damage, scattered sirens and cold wind #Sandy #acpress
Four helicopters just flew over #OceanCity surveying damage. I'll be here all day posting as many pics as possible. #sandy #acpress
6th Street in #OceanCity #NJ, two blocks from beach. #Sandy #acpress http://t.co/TqNWGM1M
Atlantic and Plymouth, facing South, #OceanCity #NJ #Sandy #aftermath http://t.co/NygI1Ft2
Van left on 7th Street in #OceanCity. Water was nine feet deep in some places on island. #sandynj #aftermath #acpress http://t.co/4RHAC0qY
Oil-filled water & muck blanket every street three blocks from bay at middle of #OceanCity #Sandy #aftermath #acpress http://t.co/UGVf8Vku
This dock didn't make it. #OceanCity #Sandy #aftermath #acpress http://t.co/8lf2SBcw
One of innumerable piers washed up on land by #Sandy in #OceanCity #NJ #acpress http://t.co/PrESnE0R
This grass and garbage covers every inch of the city #OceanCity #nj #aftermath #acpress #Sandy http://t.co/gufgTnOI
Huge collection of debris at end of 6th Street. Smells like pure gasoline here. #OceanCity #acpress #Sandy #aftermath http://t.co/4Btxyg09
Someone's roof on 6th Street. #Sandy #aftermath #acpress #OceanCity #nj #disaster http://t.co/yeXmPkxv
Bleachers turned garbage receptacle @ Richard Grimes Field #Sandy #OceanCity #aftermath #acpress http://t.co/CpoPrIce
Tires, bags of garbage, metal drums and lots of reeds at #OceanCity primary school #Sandy #acpress http://t.co/mR2nfnz6
Like an airshow in #OceanCity right now. Lots of planes, copters flying overhead, maybe helping, or curious #Sandy http://t.co/9zLhut4x
Tree uprooted, debris hanging from wires, road covered in mud 7th between Asbury & West #OceanCity #Sandy #acpress http://t.co/OqBymqDE
6th Street in #OceanCity #nj #Sandy #acpress http://t.co/SzCtipJx
Several awnings blew off hotels in downtown #ocnj and still deep water on many near-ocean streets #SandyNJ #acpress http://t.co/v2qAS4fE

Absolute river on 11th Street in #OCNJ
#Sandy #ACPress
Pretty clear how high the water was on 9th Street in #OCNJ. There's an "I've had it up to here!" joke in this. #Sandy http://t.co/aCfHeJUF
#Sandy left plenty of tricks behind for Halloween, like garbage and oil-laden mud on #OCNJ streets #acpress #aftermath http://t.co/bJH2P3Ro
Some great pics here: "@NJSP: Photos from Governor Christie's damage survey http://t.co/1tWp7nct”
Homeowners in #OCNJ south end digging river through sand to let water out of flooded garage. #ACPress #PostSandy http://t.co/7dD8dwDn
Residents in #OCNJ's south end had to dig a hole down to get in their front door after #Sandy's surge overtopped dunes http://t.co/bFSimXW8
@kellllyr0se Safe to say everyone got flooded, only difference is how many feet. I didn't see any spot without debris.
@PhilEager sand stretched a block and a half from the ocean in south end, but mud literally everywhere. Southern Central Ave like dirt road
@quirkyandklutzy everywhere got flooded, just different levels. Asbury saw a foot and a half of water, plus lots of mud and debris in dtown
#OCNJ still restricting eastbound lanes across 9th St bridge but plan to let residents in soon. No sightseers. #ACPress #SandyAftermath
I'll be in #OCNJ again today looking for ppl putting lives back together. Still travel restrictions getting on island. #acpress #Sandy
Corinthian Ave at #OCNJ north end essentially dirt road Wednesday morning. #SandyAftermath #ACPress http://t.co/5qG0Xr7r
Naked geotubes, what's left of dune walkway in #OCNJ on Wednesday morning. #Sandy #ACPress http://t.co/k6NqZDyP
#OCNJ police waiting for @GovChristie to give OK to let public back on island. Scattered power, sewage back, many roads blocked #ACPress
Lots of ppl stayed in #OCNJ north end during #Sandy. One guy jacked up car, still lost it, but saved washing machine as water rose #ACPress
One reason they say it's not safe on the island: these giant boards with nails are everywhere. #OCNJ #Sandy #ACPress
@UncleDeery police say waiting on word from governor, though some homeowners have found a way on
Apparently @Discovery is in #OCNJ filming for upcoming documentary about hurricanes. Also shot Isaac, Irene damage. #Sandy #ACPress
#OCNJ reopening Route 52 and 34th St bridges to public now. Longport bridge still closed due to debris on road. #ACPress #Sandy
Theme of today seems to be most locals looking on bright side, saying storm damage is expected at the shore. #OCNJ #ACPress #Sandy
You can get to #Strathmere through #OCNJ (long line to get in), but Ocean Drive to #SIC blocked from there. #ACPess http://t.co/nnCFI9eD
Line of cars waiting to get in #OCNJ over the 34th St bridge on Wednesday afternoon. Heard same on Rt 52. #ACPress http://t.co/V8kUclkN
Prob missed it, but first I've seen the paddle wheel boat in Somers Pt. was washed aground. #Wow #Sandy #ACPress http://t.co/QYNUBqlP
All the mold in #Margate and #Longport is so jealous of #Ventnor mold. Spores are throwing a rager in my house and I can't stop it. #Sandy
Speaking for all #Ventnor residents: I don't want to go home to go to the bathroom. I want to dry out, clean my house. #officiallymad #sandy
#OCNJ high school football players don't have school so they're helping biz owners clean up today. See story tomorrow in #ACPress #PlusSide
Recap: President has time a week before Election to fly to Brigantine, Ventor gov't only has time for handful of sparse emails. #MakesSense
Knew bridge from Longport to OC was closed, but so is causeway between Longport and Somers Point? Wasn't clear to me. Guess taking long way.
